intro: Dicliptera eenii, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows in grasslands and disturbed areas, thriving in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Dicliptera eenii is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
